definition: to eliminate/to scrap
to excuse sb/to exempt/to remove or dismiss from office/to avoid/to avert/to escape/to be prohibited
old variant of 絻[wen4]

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: So, there I was, on the phone requesting the representative to waive the 28 dollars for me.
sentences.chinese: 于是我就在电话上请求业务代表免掉那28块。

sentences.english: A. Have you heard that the I'm losing my manager position?
sentences.chinese: 老板要免掉我的经理职务，你听说了吗？

sentences.english: I'll see if I can get you out of homework tonight .
sentences.chinese: 我来看看是否能给你免掉今晚的家庭作业。

sentences.english: He has been quietlybooted out as chief.
sentences.chinese: 他己被悄悄地免掉主任的职务。

sentences.english: Have you heard that the I'm losing my manager position?
sentences.chinese: 老板要免掉我的经理职务，你听说了吗？

sentences.english: John:Have you heard that the I'm losing my manager position?
sentences.chinese: 老板要免掉我的经理职务，你听说了吗？

sentences.english: I do not pretend that marriage can be freed from onerous duties.
sentences.chinese: 我并不假装，说婚姻可以免掉它繁重的职责。

definition: to prevent/to avoid/to excuse/to exempt/to relieve/(of a debt) to remit
to reduce or waive (taxes, punishment, rent, tuition etc)
to deduct (points etc)
to pay (taxes or dues)
to pay as charged
to pay up/to shell out/to hand over the money to cover sth
to use in payment/to compensate
restored to one's official post/to send sb back to his former post
to be punished for a crime
cost/expenditure/expense/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]
to write off at one stroke
to hand in/to hand over/to seize
to eliminate/to expel/to abolish
tax money/tax due
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
demotion to commoner (idiom)
